title: Fredericksburg & Spotsylvania National Military Park: The Fields of Battle
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Stories     The Fields of Battle                 The Fields of Battle         Prospect Hill at Sunset Buddy Secor   Battle of Fredericksburg  A winter campaign which illuminates the influence of politics and miscommunication on the battlefield, resulting in one of the most lopsided Confederate victories of the war.           Location of Stonewall Jackson's Flank Attack Buddy Secor   Battle of Chancellorsville A dramatic battle which is widely considered Robert E. Lee's greatest victory, the battle of Chancellorsville was one of the most confusing and costly of the entire war. Between the wounding of General Stonewall Jackson and the loss of troops, was what Lee lost worth what he gained?        New Jersey Monument at the Bloody Angle NPS Photo   Battles of Wilderness and Spotsylvania The opening two engagements of the pivotal Overland Campaign, this was the first time Ulysses S. Grant and Robert E. Lee met each other on a field of battle. The style of warfare would also change dramatically in 1864.
